bitfields.name: BOOT_CFG_LOCK
bitfields.description: When set, BOOT_CFG_LOCK[2:0] bits controls read/write/override protection to BOOT_CFG 0-6 fuse words.

bitfields.name: SEC_BOOT_CFG_LOCK
bitfields.description: When set, SEC_BOOT_CFG_LOCK[2:0] bits controls read/write/override protection to SEC_BOOT_CFG 0-8 fuse words.

bitfields.name: DCFG_CC_SOCU_NS_LOCK
bitfields.description: When set, DCFG_CC_SOCU_NS_LOCK[2:0] bits controls read/write/override protection to DCFG_CC_SOCU_NS fuse word.

bitfields.name: LOCK_CFG_LOCK
bitfields.description: When set, LOCK_CFG_LOCK[2:0] bits controls read/write/override protection to LOCK_CFG 0-2 fuse words.

bitfields.name: CUST_KEY_LOCK
bitfields.description: When set, CUST_KEY_LOCK[2:0] bits controls read/write/override protection to CUST_SK_MK and RKTH fuse words.

bitfields.name: DCFG_CC_SOCU_LOCK
bitfields.description: When set, DCFG_CC_SOCU_LOCK[2:0] bits controls read/write/override protection to DCFG_CC_SOCU and DCFG_CC_SOCU_AP fuse words.

bitfields.name: LIFECYCLE_LOCK
bitfields.description: When set, LIFECYCLE_LOCK[2:0] bits controls read/write/override protection to LIFE_CYCLE_STATE fuse word.

bitfields.name: CRC_HI_LOCK
bitfields.description: When set, CRC_HI_LOCK[2:0] bits controls read/write/override protection to CRC 4-7 fuse words.

bitfields.name: CRC_LO_LOCK
bitfields.description: When set, CRC_LO_LOCK[2:0] bits controls read/write/override protection to CRC 0-3 fuse words.

bitfields.name: PRIMARY_BOOT_SOURCE
bitfields.description: Primary boot source. (a.k.a. Master boot source)

values.name: ISP_PIN_BOOT
values.description: ISP pins will determine boot source.

values.name: FLEXSPI_BOOT
values.description: Boot from FlexSPI flash device using FlexSPI interface pins.

values.name: SPI_BOOT
values.description: Boot using SPI slave interface using master boot mode.

values.name: UART_BOOT
values.description: Boot using UART interface using master boot mode.

values.name: ISP_MODE
values.description: Always enter ISP mode. DEFAULT_ISP_MODE field will determine the ISP interface.

values.name: QSPI_FALLBACK_SPINOR_BOOT
values.description: Boot from Octal/Quad SPI flash device using FlexSPI channel A interface pins. If image is not found check recovery boot using SPI flash device through FlexComm.

bitfields.name: DEFAULT_ISP_MODE
bitfields.description: ISP boot mode

values.name: AUTO_ISP
values.description: Auto detect ISP mode. The RW61x probes active peripheral from one of the below serial interfaces and download image from the probed peripherals: UART, I2C, SPI, USB-HID.

values.name: USB_HID_ISP
values.description: The USB HID class is used to download the image of the USB0 port.

values.name: UART_ISP
values.description: Support ISP command interface on UART port only.

values.name: SPI_ISP
values.description: Support ISP command interface on SPI port only.

values.name: I2C_ISP
values.description: Support ISP command interface on I2C port only.

values.name: DISABLE_ISP
values.description: Disable ISP fall through when proper image is not found on primary boot device.

bitfields.name: BOOT_CLK_SPEED
bitfields.description: Defines clock speeds during boot.

bitfields.name: STOP_ON_FAILURE
bitfields.description: If set, then enables GPIO Port and PIN information upon failure.

bitfields.name: TZM_IMAGE_TYPE
bitfields.description: TrustZone-M mode

values.name: ENFORCE_PRESET_VALUE
values.description: Enforce preset TZM data in image manifest.

values.name: ENFORCE_PRESET_VALUE
values.description: Enforce preset TZM data in image manifest.

values.name: ENFORCE_PRESET_VALUE
values.description: Enforce preset TZM data in image manifest.

bitfields.name: REDUNDANT_SPI_PORT
bitfields.description: FlexComm port to use for redundant SPI flash boot.

values.name: FC0
values.description: Use FlexCom0 pins P0_0 (SCK), P0_1 (MISO), P0_2 (MOSI), P0_3 (SEL).

values.name: FC1
values.description: Use FlexCom1 pins P0_7 (SCK), P0_8 (MISO), P0_9 (MOSI), P0_10 (SEL).

values.name: FC2
values.description: Use FlexCom2 pins P0_14 (SCK), P0_15 (MISO), P0_16 (MOSI), P0_17 (SEL).

values.name: FC3
values.description: Use FlexCom3 pins P0_21 (SCK), P0_22 (MISO), P0_23 (MOSI), P0_24 (SEL).

values.name: FC4
values.description: Use FlexCom4 pins P0_28 (SCK), P0_29 (MISO), P0_30 (MOSI), P0_31 (SEL).

values.name: FC5
values.description: Use FlexCom5 pins P1_3 (SCK), P1_4 (MISO), P1_5 (MOSI), P1_6 (SEL).

values.name: FC6
values.description: Use FlexCom6 pins P3_25 (SCK), P3_26 (MISO), P3_27 (MOSI), P3_28 (SEL).

values.name: FC7
values.description: Use FlexCom7 pins P4_0 (SCK), P4_1 (MISO), P4_2 (MOSI), P4_3 (SEL).

bitfields.name: SECURE_BOOT_EN
bitfields.description: Secure boot enable config

values.name: DISABLED
values.description: Allow non-secure images with and without CRC. Used during development.

values.name: ENABLED
values.description: Secure boot is enabled. Do complete ECDSA checking of signed images. (ECDSA signed)

values.name: ENABLED
values.description: Secure boot is enabled. Do complete ECDSA checking of signed images. (ECDSA signed)

bitfields.name: DICE_INC_OTP
bitfields.description: Include OTP fuse area in DICE computation

bitfields.name: DICE_SKIP
bitfields.description: Skip DICE computation

bitfields.name: BOOT_FAIL_PORT
bitfields.description: GPIO port number to use for indicating boot failure. Defines GPIO port number.

bitfields.name: BOOT_FAIL_PIN
bitfields.description:
Defines GPIO pin number.
Note: Please note GPIO[22:27] can not be used as BOOT_FAIL pins.

registers.name: BOOT_CFG1
registers.description: Boot configuration word specifying FlexSPI flash devices settings.

bitfields.name: FLEXSPI_AUTO_PROBE_EN
bitfields.description: Flash auto probe feature enable. Auto probing is enabled if the bit is 1.

values.name: FLASH_AUTO_PROBE
values.description: The Boot ROM looks for a FCB on the flash. Boot ROM reads a 512 byte FCB into on-chip SRAM and configures the FlexSPI controller accordingly.

values.name: FCB_FROM_FLASH
values.description: The Boot ROM will perform flash auto probe sequence using parameters from OTP fuse values for FLEXSPI_PROBE_TYPE, FLEXSPI_FLASH_TYPE, FLEXSPI_DUMMY_CYCLES, FLEXSPI_FREQUENCY.

bitfields.name: FLEXSPI_PROBE_TYPE
bitfields.description: Flash probe type

bitfields.name: FLEXSPI_FLASH_TYPE
bitfields.description: Flash type. This field affects the default configuration of the Boot ROM Flash driver (before any input from flash itself is available).

values.name: FLEXSPI_SDR_3B
values.description: Device supports SDR and uses 3 byte addresses for read. In case of autoprobing, when generating an FCB from the SFDP information, commands for SRD operation are generated. In case of configuration from FCB, for reading of flash memory, command 0x03 is used.

values.name: FLEXSPI_DDR_4B
values.description: Device supports DDR and uses 4 byte addresses for read. In case of autoprobing, when generating an FCB from the SFDP information, the command set for DDR operation is used. In case of configuration from FCB, for reading of flash memory, command 0x13 is used.

bitfields.name: FLEXSPI_DUMMY_CYCLES
bitfields.description: Dummy cycles for read command.

values.name: AUTO_PROB
values.description: The dummy cycles are probed automatically.
The number of dummy cycles is 1.
The number of dummy cycles is 2.
The number of dummy cycles is 3.
The number of dummy cycles is 4.
The number of dummy cycles is 5.
The number of dummy cycles is 6.
The number of dummy cycles is 7.
The number of dummy cycles is 8.
The number of dummy cycles is 9.
The number of dummy cycles is 10.
The number of dummy cycles is 11.
The number of dummy cycles is 12.
The number of dummy cycles is 13.
The number of dummy cycles is 14.
The number of dummy cycles is 15.

bitfields.name: FLEXSPI_FREQUENCY
bitfields.description: Flash SPI clock frequency to use for auto probing.

values.name: FLEXSPI_100MHZ
values.description: Use a clock frequency of 100 MHz.

values.name: FLEXSPI_120MHZ
values.description: Use a clock frequency of 120 MHz.

values.name: FLEXSPI_133MHZ
values.description: Use a clock frequency of 133 MHz.

values.name: FLEXSPI_166MHZ
values.description: Use a clock frequency of 166 MHz.

values.name: FLEXSPI_200MHZ
values.description: Use a clock frequency of 200 MHz.

values.name: FLEXSPI_80MHZ
values.description: Use a clock frequency of 80 MHz.

values.name: FLEXSPI_60MHZ
values.description: Use a clock frequency of 60 MHz.

values.name: FLEXSPI_50MHZ
values.description: Use a clock frequency of 50 MHz.

bitfields.name: FLEXSPI_RST_SEQ
bitfields.description: Select the flash reset sequence to use for regular boot.

values.name: JEDEC_RESET
values.description: The Boot ROM performs a reset sequence according to the JEDEC specification.

values.name: RESET_COMMAND
values.description: The Boot ROM sends commands for resetting the flash. The sequence is fixed command byte 0x66 (enable reset) followed by command byte 0x99 (reset device) using SPI (single wire).

values.name: WAKEUP_COMMAND
values.description: The Boot ROM sends a wakeup command to the flash. The sequence is fixed command byte 0xAB using SPI (single wire). As the wakeup command is using SPI, it has to be ensured that the flash is in a mode where it can accept SPI commands before the system is put to low-power mode.

bitfields.name: FLEXSPI_RST_HOLD_TIME
bitfields.description: Set the time to wait after reset sequence for regular boot.

bitfields.name: FLEXSPI_WUP_SEQ
bitfields.description: Select the flash reset sequence to use for boot from low power mode.

values.name: JEDEC_RESET
values.description: The Boot ROM performs a reset sequence according to the JEDEC specification.

values.name: RESET_COMMAND
values.description: The Boot ROM sends commands for resetting the flash. The sequence is fixed command byte 0x66 (enable reset) followed by command byte 0x99 (reset device) using SPI (single wire).

values.name: WAKEUP_COMMAND
values.description: The Boot ROM sends a wakeup command to the flash. The sequence is fixed command byte 0xAB using SPI (single wire). As the wakeup command is using SPI, it has to be ensured that the flash is in a mode where it can accept SPI commands before the system is put to low-power mode.

bitfields.name: FLEXSPI_WUP_HOLD_TIME
bitfields.description: Set the time to wait after reset sequence for boot from low power mode.

bitfields.name: FLEXSPI_HOLD_TIME
bitfields.description: Wait time before access to Serial Flash.

bitfields.name: FLEXSPI_PWR_HOLD_TIME
bitfields.description: Delay after POR before accessing Quad/Octal-SPI flash devices in addition to delay defined by QSPI_HOLD TIME field.

registers.name: BOOT_CFG2
registers.description: Boot configuration word specifying settings for FlexSPI image.

bitfields.name: FLEXSPI_IMAGE_SIZE
bitfields.description: The size of the flash memory to use for a boot image.

values.name: SIZE_OFFSET
values.description: The size of the boot image is considered to be equal to the offset of the second image.

bitfields.name: FLEXSPI_DELAY_CELL_NUM
bitfields.description:
Delay cell numbers for flash read sampling via DQS (either internal loopback or external DQS).

delay = 1600ps, if value = 0
delay = value * 100ps

bitfields.name: FLEXSPI_IMAGE_OFFSET
bitfields.description: The offset in flash memory where the second boot image starts. The offset to the second image is X * 256 KB.

bitfields.name: ENF_CNSA
bitfields.description: Enforce CNSA (Commercial National Security Algorithm) suite keys.

bitfields.name: ENABLE_CRC_CHECK
bitfields.description:
Enable CRC checks over OTP words.

CRC1 = CRC over OTP fuses from 15 - 21
CRC2 = CRC over OTP fuses from 00 - 02
CRC6 = CRC over OTP fuses from 92 - 115

values.name: ENABLE_NXP_OTP
values.description: Perform CRC check over NXP OTPs.

values.name: ENABLE_ALL_OTP
values.description: Perform CRC check over NXP and OEM OTPs.

bitfields.name: FIPS_KDF_STEN
bitfields.description: Enable self-test for CKDF block on power-up. Needed for FIPS certification. If this field is non-zero run self-test and log result in BOOT_STATE register.

values.name: SKIP_SELF_TEST_RUN
values.description: Self-tests run is skipped and results are not included.

values.name: SKIP_SELF_TEST_RUN

bitfields.name: FIPS_SHA_STEN

values.name: SKIP_SELF_TEST_RUN

bitfields.name: SKIP_PM_SIGN_VERIFICATION
bitfields.description: On boot-up from PM3/PM4, do not run through ECDSA signature verification of the image.

values.name: NO_SKIP
values.description: Image verification is not skipped upon wake up from PM3 and PM4.

values.name: NO_SKIP
values.description: Image verification is not skipped upon wake up from PM3 and PM4.

values.name: NO_SKIP
values.description: Image verification is not skipped upon wake up from PM3 and PM4.

values.name: SKIP
values.description: Image verification is skipped upon wake up from PM3 and PM4.

bitfields.name: SDIO_F0_BLOCKSIZE
bitfields.description:
SDIO Block F0 size
`16b00` = SDIO_F0_BLOCKSIZE will be fixed `0x1`
`SDIO_F0_BLOCKSIZE` = Fuse value

bitfields.name: SDIO_FN_BLOCKSIZE
bitfields.description:
SDIO Block FN size
`16b00` = SDIO_FN_BLOCKSIZE will be fixed `0x200`
`SDIO_FN_BLOCKSIZE` = Fuse value

bitfields.name: SDIO_REV
bitfields.description:
Configure SDIO version revision.
`8b00` = SDIO_REV will be fixed `0x30`
`SDIO_REV ` = Fuse value

bitfields.name: SDIO_SPEED

Configure SDIO Speed.
`8b00` = SDIO_SPEED will be fixed `0xB`
`SDIO_SPEED` = Fuse value

bitfields.name: SDIO_TIMEOUT

Configure SDIO Timeout.
`16b00` = SDIO_TIMEOUT will be fixed `0x14`
`SDIO_TIMEOUT` = Fuse value

bitfields.name: SEC_BOOT_CFG8
bitfields.description: User defined

registers.name: DCFG_CC_SOCU_NS
registers.description:
The DCFG_CC_SOCU_NS configuration fields can be used to increase the restriction level specified in DCFG_CC_SOCU. With TZ-M, the part can be sold by level 1 customers (secure code developer) to level-2 customers who develops non-secure code only.
    - In this scenario, or easy of development, Level-I customer releases the part to always allow non-secure debug.
    - To allow level-2 customers to further seal the part DCFG_CC_SOCU_NS is used.
    - ROM will use this word to further restrict the debug access.
    - Layout of this word is same as DCFG_CC_SOCU.
    - Combinations of PINNED_xxxEN and DFLT_xxxEN bits and resulting access restriction levels are:
    
1. PINNED_xxxEN=1,DFLT_xxxEN=1: Restriction level 0. Access to the sub-domain is always enabled. This setting is provided for module use case scenario where DCFG_CC_SOCU_NS would be used to define further access restrictions before final deployment of the product.
2. PINNED_xxxEN=0,DFLT_xxxEN=0: Restriction level 1. Access to the sub-domain is disabled at startup. But the access can be enabled through the debug authentication process by providing an appropriate Debug Credential (DC) certificate.
3. PINNED_xxxEN=0,DFLT_xxxEN=1: Illegal setting. Part will lock-up if this setting is selected.
4. PINNED_xxxEN=1,DFLT_xxxEN=0: Restriction level 2. Access to the sub-domain is permanently disabled and cannot be reversed. This setting offers the highest level of restriction.

bitfields.name: CRC8_NS
bitfields.description:
CRC-8/ITU of upper 3 bytes (bits 8 to 31). Since these fields are security critical, they are constructed with built-in integrity protection to protect from side channel glitch attacks.
The lower byte (0 to 7 bits) of these OTP words should be written with CRC-8/ITU of upper 3 bytes (bits 8 to 31). 
This construction makes the probability of a successful glitch attack to flip the exact control bits extremely difficult.
 The CRC8 calculation should be based on x8 + x2 + x + 1 polynomial. Polynomial=0x07, initial value= 0x00, XorOut=0x55

bitfields.name: DFLT_NIDEN_NS
bitfields.description: Controls non-Invasive debugging of TrustZone for Arm8-M defined non-secure domain of CPU0.

bitfields.name: DFLT_DBGEN_NS
bitfields.description: Controls invasive debugging of TrustZone for Arm8-M defined non-secure domain of CPU0.

bitfields.name: DFLT_SPNIDEN_NS
bitfields.description: Controls non-Invasive debugging of TrustZone for Arm8-M defined secure domain of CPU0

bitfields.name: DFLT_SPIDEN_NS
bitfields.description: Controls invasive debugging of TrustZone for Arm8-M defined secure domain of CPU0.

bitfields.name: DFLT_TAPEN_NS
bitfields.description: Controls TAP (Test Access Point) controller used for structural integrity testing of silicon by NXP as part of Return Material Analysis (RMA)

bitfields.name: DFLT_CPU1NIDEN_NS
bitfields.description: Controls non-Invasive debugging of CPU1.

bitfields.name: DFLT_CPU1DBGEN_NS
bitfields.description: Controls invasive debugging of CPU1.

bitfields.name: DFLT_CPU2NIDEN_NS
bitfields.description: Controls non-Invasive debugging of CPU2.

bitfields.name: DFLT_CPU2DBGEN_NS
bitfields.description: Controls invasive debugging of CPU2.

bitfields.name: DFLT_ISPCMDEN_NS
bitfields.description: Controls whether ISP boot flow DM-AP command (command code: 0x05) can be issued after authentication.

bitfields.name: DFLT_FACMDEN_NS
bitfields.description: Controls whether DM-AP Set FA Mode command (command code: 0x06) can be issued after authentication

bitfields.name: PINNED_NIDEN_NS
bitfields.description: Controls non-Invasive debugging of TrustZone for Arm8-M defined non-secure domain of CPU0

values.description: Debug Authentication Response determines the state.

bitfields.name: PINNED_FACMDEN_NS
bitfields.description: Controls whether DM-AP Set FA Mode command (command code: 0x06) can be issued after authentication

values.name: DAR_CC
values.description: Debug Authentication Response determines the state.

bitfields.name: FORCE_UUID_MATCH_NS
bitfields.description: When set, debug authentication protocol only accepts Debug Credential certificates (DC) with matching UUID.

values.name: NO_FORCE_UUID_MATCH
values.description: Accepts Debug Credential certificates (DC) with any UUID.

values.name: FORCE_UUID_MATCH
values.description: Accepts Debug Credential certificates (DC) with matching UUID.

registers.name: DCFG_CC_SOCU
registers.description:
The DCFG_CC_SOCU configuration field specifies the debug access restrictions per debug domain. The DCFG_CC_SOCU_NS fields can be used to increase the restriction level specified in DCFG_CC_SOCU but cannot be used to reduce the restriction level.
    - Combinations of PINNED_xxxEN and DFLT_xxxEN bits and resulting access restriction levels are:

 1. PINNED_xxxEN=1,DFLT_xxxEN=1: Restriction level 0. Access to the sub-domain is always enabled. This setting is provided for module use case scenario where DCFG_CC_SOCU_NS would be used to define further access restrictions before final deployment of the product. 
 2. PINNED_xxxEN=0,DFLT_xxxEN=0: Restriction level 1. Access to the sub-domain is disabled at startup. But the access can be enabled through the debug authentication process by providing an appropriate Debug Credential (DC) certificate. 
 3. PINNED_xxxEN=0,DFLT_xxxEN=1: Illegal setting. Part will lock-up if this setting is selected. 
 4. PINNED_xxxEN=1,DFLT_xxxEN=0: Restriction level 2. Access to the sub-domain is permanently disabled and cannot be reversed. This setting offers the highest level of restriction.

bitfields.name: CRC8
bitfields.description:
CRC-8/ITU of upper 3 bytes (bits 8 to 31). Since these fields are security critical, they are constructed with built-in integrity protection to protect from side channel glitch attacks.
The lower byte (0 to 7 bits) of these OTP words should be written with CRC-8/ITU of upper 3 bytes (bits 8 to 31). 
This construction makes the probability of a successful glitch attack to flip the exact control bits extremely difficult.
 The CRC8 calculation should be based on x8 + x2 + x + 1 polynomial. Polynomial=0x07, initial value= 0x00, XorOut=0x55

bitfields.description: Controls TAP (Test Access Point) controller used for structural integrity testing of silicon by NXP as part of Return Material Analysis (RMA)

registers.name: DCFG_CC_SOCU_AP
registers.description:
Anti-pole (inverse) value of Debug Configuration word (DCFG_CC_SOCU).  DCFG_CC_SOCU_AP should be programmed with the exact anti-pole (inverse value) value of DCFG_CC_SOCU. 
Any mismatch between DCFG_CC_SOCU and DCFG_CC_SOCU_AP is deemed as an attack and device is locked permanently.

bitfields.name: CRC8_AP
bitfields.description:
CRC-8/ITU of upper 3 bytes (bits 8 to 31). Since these fields are security critical, they are constructed with built-in integrity protection to protect from side channel glitch attacks.
The lower byte (0 to 7 bits) of these OTP words should be written with CRC-8/ITU of upper 3 bytes (bits 8 to 31). 
This construction makes the probability of a successful glitch attack to flip the exact control bits extremely difficult.
 The CRC8 calculation should be based on x8 + x2 + x + 1 polynomial. Polynomial=0x07, initial value= 0x00, XorOut=0x55

registers.name: LIFE_CYCLE_STATE
registers.description: Life cycle state of rw61x platform.

bitfields.name: LCS
bitfields.description: Possible values of rw61x lifecycle states

values.name: Develop
values.description: Initial customer development state after leaving NXP manufacturing.

values.name: Develop2
values.description: Optional customer development state. Used for development of NS world code.

values.name: In-Field
values.description: In-field application state for end-customer use.

values.name: In-Field Locked
values.description: Alternative in-field application state that disables debug capability and prevents use of field return/failure analysis states. The rest of the behavior of the device is same as the In-field state.

values.name: Shredded
values.description: Bricked state to prevent device use.

bitfields.name: LCS_REDUNDANT
bitfields.description: Repeat values of lifecycle state due to a security
